intro: Cleistes metallina, commonly known as the metallic cleistostoma, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with a unique, intricate structure. Cleistes metallina is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
